metadata.title: CVE-2019-3814 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
It was discovered that Dovecot before versions 2.2.36.1 and 2.3.4.1incorrectly handled client certificates. A remote attacker in possession ofa valid certificate with an empty username field could possibly use thisissue to impersonate other users.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3814` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dovecot package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.5').
